meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a meritocracy.
meanings.sent1: The school's meritocratic system rewarded students based on their hard work and achievements.
meanings.sent2: In a meritocratic society, individuals are judged based on their abilities and efforts.
meanings.sent3: The meritocratic nature of the competition made everyone strive to do their best.
meanings.sent4: Her rise to the top was a testament to the meritocratic values of the organization.
meanings.sent5: The meritocratic process ensured that only the most deserving candidates were selected.

meanings.definition: Operating on the principle of merit.
meanings.sent1: The company's meritocratic approach promoted fairness and equal opportunities for all employees.
meanings.sent2: A meritocratic system encourages individuals to excel and be recognized for their hard work.
meanings.sent3: The office's meritocratic culture led to healthy competition among colleagues.
meanings.sent4: His success in the company was a result of the meritocratic policies in place.
meanings.sent5: The meritocratic environment motivated employees to constantly improve and strive for excellence.
